intro: Adenandra, commonly known as the silver tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Proteaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its distinctive silver-green foliage and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. Adenandra species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and drought tolerance. They play an important ecological role in their native habitats by providing habitat and food for local wildlife.
